title: Potential energy graph - object at rest

content.question: At which of the following positions does the object come to rest?

choices.label: <math alttext="x equals 5 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>5</mtext><mtext> </mtext><mtext> m</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="x equals15 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>15</mn><mtext> m</mtext><mtext></mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

Between <math alttext="x equals 18 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>18</mn><mtext> m</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="x equals 20 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>20</mn><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
At no point on the graph does the object come to rest.

content.answer: At no point on the graph does the object come to rest.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
